Package model.storage

Class Warehouse

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.storage.Warehouse
All Implemented Interfaces:
Observable
public class Warehouse
extends java.lang.Object
implements Observable
This class represents the player board's warehouse, intended as the collection of all of its depots (both the basic, starting ones and the ones obtained through other means).

  • Constructor Details

    • Warehouse

      public Warehouse​(int numOfBasicDepots)
      The class constructor
      Parameters:
      numOfBasicDepots - the number of basic depots in the warehouse

  • Method Details

    • addNewDepot

      public void addNewDepot​(ResourceDepot depot)
      Adds the given depot to the list of available depots
      Parameters:
      depot - the depot to be added

    • addToDepot

      public void addToDepot​(int depotNumber, ResourceType resource, int quantity) throws DepotNotPresentException, NotEnoughSpaceException, WrongResourceInsertionException, BlockedResourceException
      Adds the given quantity of the given resource to the given depot
      Parameters:
      depotNumber - the number of the depot to which to add the resource
      resource - the resource to be added
      quantity - the quantity of the resource to add
      Throws:
      DepotNotPresentException - if the number of the target depot does not correspond to any depot in the warehouse
      WrongResourceInsertionException - if the type of the resource to be added cannot (currently) be added to the target depot
      NotEnoughSpaceException - if the quantity of the resource to be added plus the amount already stored in the target depot exceeds the depot's maximum capacity
      BlockedResourceException - if the depot is affected by resource blocking and the resource is being blocked by a different depot

    • removeFromDepot

      public void removeFromDepot​(int depotNumber, ResourceType resource, int quantity) throws DepotNotPresentException, NotEnoughResourceException
      Removes the given quantity of the given resource to the given depot
      Parameters:
      depotNumber - the index of the depot from which to remove the resource
      resource - the resource to be removed
      quantity - the quantity of the resource to remove
      Throws:
      DepotNotPresentException - if the number of the target depot does not correspond to any depot in the warehouse
      NotEnoughResourceException - if the given resource is not present in the target depot in the amount to be deleted

    • swapDepotContent

      public void swapDepotContent​(int depotNumber1, int depotNumber2) throws DepotNotPresentException, ParametersNotValidException, SwapNotValidException
      Swaps the contents of two warehouse depots
      Parameters:
      depotNumber1 - the number of the first depot
      depotNumber2 - the number of the second depot
      Throws:
      DepotNotPresentException - if one of the depot numbers given does not correspond with any depot
      ParametersNotValidException - if the two inputs are the same number or below 1
      SwapNotValidException - if the content of one or both of the depots cannot be transferred to the other

    • moveDepotContent

      public void moveDepotContent​(int depotNumberTake, int depotNumberGive, ResourceType resource, int quantity) throws DepotNotPresentException, NotEnoughResourceException, BlockedResourceException, WrongResourceInsertionException, NotEnoughSpaceException
      Moves a certain amount of resource from one depot to another
      Parameters:
      depotNumberTake - the number of the depot from which to take the resources
      depotNumberGive - the number of the depot to which to move the resources
      resource - the resource to move between the two depots
      quantity - the quantity of the resource to move
      Throws:
      DepotNotPresentException - if one of the depot numbers given does not correspond with any depot
      ParametersNotValidException - if the two inputs are the same number or below 1
      NotEnoughResourceException - if the given resource is not present in the providing depot in the amount to be deleted
      WrongResourceInsertionException - if the type of the resource to be added cannot (currently) be added to the receiving depot
      NotEnoughSpaceException - if the quantity of the resource to be added plus the amount already stored in the receiving depot exceeds the depot's maximum capacity
      BlockedResourceException - if the receiving depot is affected by resource blocking and the resource is being blocked by a different depot

    • isResourceBlocked

      public boolean isResourceBlocked​(ResourceType resource, java.util.List<ResourceDepot> exclusions)
      Returns whether or not the given resource is blocked by one of the depots in the warehouse, excluding those provided in the exclusions list
      Parameters:
      resource - the resource that might be blocked
      exclusions - the depots exempted from the search
      Returns:
      true if one of the depots is blocking the resource

    • getNumOfDepots

      public int getNumOfDepots()
      Returns the number of depots currently accessible in the warehouse
      Returns:
      the number of depots

    • getDepot

      public ResourceDepot getDepot​(int depotNumber)
      Returns the depot corresponding to the given number
      Parameters:
      depotNumber - the number of the depot to get (STARTS FROM 1)
      Returns:
      the requested depot

    • getNumOfResource

      public int getNumOfResource​(ResourceType resource)
      Returns the total stored amount of the given resource among all warehouse depots
      Parameters:
      resource - the resource the amount of which is asked
      Returns:
      the sum of the amounts of the given resource contained within all depots

    • getStoredResources

      public java.util.List<ResourceType> getStoredResources()
      Returns the resources present in the warehouse
      Returns:
      a List of the resources stored in the warehouse

    • getDepotCardId

      public int[] getDepotCardId()
      Returns an array of the depot's card id, or 0 if they are not leader depots
      Returns:
      an array of the id of the cards that activated the depots.

    • restoreDepots

      public void restoreDepots​(ResourceType[] depotType, int[] depotQuantity)
      Restores the contents of the warehouse's depots
      Parameters:
      depotType - the type of resource stored in each depot
      depotQuantity - the amount of resource stored in each depot

    • notifyObservers

      public void notifyObservers()
      This method calls the update() on every object observing this object
      Specified by:
      notifyObservers in interface Observable

      Parameters:
      observer - the Observer to be added
